[et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” admin_label=”Offer” _builder_version=”4.6.6″ background_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.5)” background_image=”https://discover-destinations.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/jwkk-0zbuyg-scaled.jpg” custom_padding=”120px||79px||false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”80px||80px|” custom_padding_phone=”” hover_enabled=”0″ locked=”off” alt=”five brown wooden boats” title_text=”Photo by Sumit Chinchane” sticky_enabled=”0″][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_margin=”|||”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”CTA Section Title” _builder_version=”3.27.4″ text_font=”||||” header_font=”Oswald|on||on|” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”60px” header_line_height=”1.3em” background_layout=”dark” custom_margin=”|||” custom_padding=”|||” animation_style=”zoom” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”20%” locked=”off”]

TREMENDOUS THAILAND
09 NIGHTS/10 DAYS

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_divider color=”#ffffff” divider_position=”center” divider_weight=”3px” disabled_on=”off|off|off” _builder_version=”3.2″ max_width=”150px” module_alignment=”center” height=”false” animation_style=”zoom” animation_delay=”200ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”20%” locked=”off”][/et_pb_divider][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|tablet” admin_label=”Packages” _builder_version=”3.22″ custom_padding=”39px||0px||false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”0px||0px|” custom_padding_phone=””][et_pb_row custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” admin_label=”Packages Title” _builder_version=”3.25″ min_height=”319px” custom_margin=”|auto|102px|auto||” custom_padding=”30px|0px|0px|0px|false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”60px||0px|” custom_padding_phone=”” locked=”off”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.27.4″ text_font=”||||” text_text_color=”#1a1a1a” header_font=”Oswald|on||on|” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”60px” header_line_height=”1.3em” custom_margin=”|||” custom_padding=”|||” animation_style=”slide” animation_direction=”top” animation_intensity_slide=”10%” locked=”off”]

Itinerary

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_divider color=”#ed4441″ divider_position=”center” divider_weight=”3px” disabled_on=”off|off|off” _builder_version=”3.2″ max_width=”150px” module_alignment=”center” height=”false” custom_margin=”30px|||” animation_style=”slide” animation_direction=”top” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_slide=”10%” locked=”off”][/et_pb_divider][et_pb_text admin_label=”Description” _builder_version=”4.6.5″ text_font=”Roboto||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_margin=”9px|||||” custom_padding=”4px||0px|||” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”10%” locked=”off” inline_fonts=”Oswald”]

DAY 01: ARRIVAL AT BANGKOK

Arrive at Bangkok International Airport. Meet & Greet by a local English–speaking guide at the arrival terminal. Then transfer to the hotel for check-in. Overnight at Bangkok.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Description” _builder_version=”4.6.6″ text_font=”Roboto||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_margin=”0px|||||” custom_padding=”0px||0px||false|false” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”10%” hover_enabled=”0″ locked=”off” inline_fonts=”Oswald” min_height=”291px” sticky_enabled=”0″]

DAY 02: BANGKOK CITY TOUR & TEMPLES TOUR

Breakfast at the hotel. Visit three of the most impressive temples: Wat Trimit with its Golden Buddha; Wat Po with its massive Reclining Buddha and Wat Benjamaborpit – the Marble Temple. Visit the Grand Palace, once a Royal Residence. It is an architectural wonder of golden stupas, walls and pillars encrusted in shining and colorful mosaics. Previously the residence of past Kings of Thailand, Kings of Thailand, you will see palaces once used for different occasions; the Reception Hall, the Coronation Hall, the Throne Hall, the Royal Guest House. See and marvel the mysterious Emerald Buddha, the most revered Buddha image in Thailand.

Overnight at Bangkok.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Description” _builder_version=”3.27.4″ text_font=”Roboto||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_margin=” 0px|||||” custom_padding=”0px||0px||false|false” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”10%” hover_enabled=”0″ locked=”off” inline_fonts=”Oswald” min_height=”342px” sticky_enabled=”0″]

DAY 03: BANGKOK / DAMOEN SADUAK FLOATING MARKET / KANCHANABURI

Check out from the hotel, and drive to Damoen Saduak Floating Market, (1½ hour drive). Your journey commences with a leisurely drive through rice paddies and salt fields. Experience the Boat trip and venture among shopping boats selling all kinds of products. Depart for Kanchanaburi; (1½ hour drive). It is Thailand’s third largest province with an area of 19,486 square kilometers. The provincial area is mountainous and has the west border next to Myanmar. Then visit to JEATH War Museum, a realistic depiction of prisoner of war living quarters, with photographic, pictorial and physical memorabilia dating from World War II. Continue to Kanchanaburi War Cemetery it contains the remains of 6,982 war prisoners (mostly the British, Dutch, Australian and American) who lost their lives during the construction of the Bridge over the River Kwai and the railway to Burma (the Death Railway). Take a ride through history on the Death Railway Train along picturesque scenic routes pass the several beautiful mountains and River Kwai. Visit to Bridge over the River Kwai, a part of the Death Railway constructed by Allied prisoners of war. Take leisurely walks around town and pictures on the world-renowned Death Railway.

Overnight at Bangkok.

 

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Description” _builder_version=”4.6.6″ text_font=”Roboto||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_margin=” 0px|||||” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”10%” hover_enabled=”0″ locked=”off” inline_fonts=”Oswald” sticky_enabled=”0″]

DAY 04: DAY TRIP TO PATTAYA

Breakfast at the hotel. Pick up at hotel lobby for Pattaya tour (Nong Nooch Village & Show + Mini Siam) with PVT transfer (with English Speaking guide) Pattaya Floating Market – Covering an area of 100,000sqm, the Four Regions Floating Market is separated into four sections – each representing and selling items from the four major parts of Thailand (north, northeast, central and south). Expect to find many eateries, fruit stalls, souvenir shops and some art galleries. There is also a cultural show every afternoon. The 350 million baht market has over 114 shops and water vendors selling authentic Thai food, desserts and specialties from all over the kingdom. For a floating market experience, hire a man-powered boat to get around and discover the richness of the surrounding Thai architecture and riverside life. Typically, the boat is big enough for four people and can be hired for a small fee for around 30 minutes. Nong Nooch Village & Show – Nong Nooch Garden is set in a 2.4sq.km. beautifully landscaped park and can easily make an all-day trip. The entire area is more like a theme park, with daily cultural shows, restaurants and accommodation as well as a vast area showcasing individually themed gardens. A leisurely stroll through the botanical park is like taking a journey around the world, through its many famous gardens. Mini Siam Pattaya – The park behind the Pattaya Boxing World stadium is home to nearly 100 replicas of famous sites worldwide – from the Temple of the Emerald Buddha to the Statue of Liberty – all displayed at a scale of 1:25. It is the perfect place to try and play Gulliver’s Travel. Founded in 1985 as part of a research project, Mini Siam’s 46,400-sqm area is divided into two distinct zones, namely Mini Siam and Mini Europe (which is actually the rest of the world), separated by a small serpentine ‘river’ that you can just step across. The vast manicured grounds, peppered with water features and man-made sculptures modelled after the world’s iconic landmarks, feel like a true global village.

Overnight at Bangkok.

 

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Description” _builder_version=”4.6.5″ text_font=”Roboto||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_margin=”0px|||||” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”10%” locked=”off” inline_fonts=”Oswald”]

DAY 05: DAY AT LEISURE

Breakfast at the hotel. Day at leisure on your own to explore.

 

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Description” _builder_version=”4.6.5″ text_font=”Roboto||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_margin=”0px||33px|||” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”10%” locked=”off” inline_fonts=”Oswald”]

DAY 06: FLIGHT TO CHIANG RAI

After Breakfast, transfer to Airport for flight to Chiang Rai. Arrival in Chiang Rai. Meet our airport representative at Chiang Rai airport. Transfer enroute to do Golden Triangle and Hill tribe Village tour. Visit the white temple designed by the famous national artist. The main temple building is a distinctive white color, decorated with fragments of reflective glass which can be seen from afar. Continue to the Golden Triangle, (1 hour drive) where the borders of three countries; Thailand, Laos, and Myanmar are met. See the panoramic view of Mekong River and discover the rich minority cultures that occupy these rolling hills on this half-day tour. Then transfer to the hotel for check in.

Overnight at Chiang Rai.

 

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Description” _builder_version=”4.6.6″ text_font=”Roboto||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_margin=”0px|||||” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”10%” hover_enabled=”0″ locked=”off” inline_fonts=”Oswald” sticky_enabled=”0″]

DAY 07: CHIANG MAI LONG NECK / MAE / SAI

After Breakfast, Visit Long Neck Tribe. A woman generally has about twenty or more rings around her neck. They are originated from Myanmar. Depart to Mae Sai Town, (45 minute drive) the Thailand-Myanmar border and the northernmost point of Thailand. Enjoy shopping the Myanmar products at the local market. Then transfer to the hotel. free at leisure.

Overnight at Chiang Mai.

 

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Description” _builder_version=”4.6.5″ text_font=”Roboto||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_margin=”0px|||||” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”10%” locked=”off” inline_fonts=”Oswald”]

DAY 08: TRANSFER TO CHIANG MAI AIRPORT FOR FLIGHT  TO PHUKET

Transfer to Airport after breakfast. Meet our airport representative at Phuket airport. transfer enroute to do Phuket City Tour. After the tour, transfer to hotel, check in.

Overnight at Phuket.

 

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Description” _builder_version=”4.6.6″ text_font=”Roboto||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_margin=” 0px|||||” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”10%” hover_enabled=”0″ locked=”off” inline_fonts=”Oswald” sticky_enabled=”0″]

DAY 09: PHI PHI ISLAND TOUR

Pick up at hotel lobby for full day Phi Phi Island Tour by Speed Boat with Lunch.

Overnight at Phuket.

 

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Description” _builder_version=”4.6.5″ text_font=”Roboto||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_margin=”0px|||||” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”10%” locked=”off” inline_fonts=”Oswald”]

DAY 10: DEPARTURE

Breakfast at the hotel and then transfer to Airport.

Have a happy and safe trip!

 

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|tablet” admin_label=”More Places” _builder_version=”3.0.76″ min_height=”926px” custom_margin=”-114px||-147px|||” custom_padding=”66px||0px||false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”80px||80px|” custom_padding_phone=”” global_module=”117″ saved_tabs=”all” locked=”off”][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ _builder_version=”4.6.5″ min_height=”0px” custom_margin=”-2px|auto||auto||” custom_padding=”1px|0px||0px||”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_blurb url=”http://www.facebook.com/pages/Discover-Destinations/156630901051625″ use_icon=”on” font_icon=”%%291%%” icon_color=”#0c71c3″ _builder_version=”3.15″]
